item.title: Family Relationships
item.description: Immediate Family father, mother, son, daughter, brother, sister Different Generations Great compounds are hyphenated: great-great-grandfather, great-great-grandmother, great-great-grandson, great-great-granddaughter, great-grandfather, great-grandmother, great-grandson, great-granddaughter, great-uncle, great-aunt Grand compounds are closed: grandfather, grandmother, grandson, granddaughter Relatives, Extended Family uncle, aunt, cousin, nephew, niece Mixed Families Step compounds are closed, except with grand and great: stepfather, stepmother, stepson, stepdaughter, stepsister, stepbrother, step-grandfather, step-grandmother When referring to a sibling, the compound is open: half brother, half sister
